intro: Habranthus vittatus, commonly known as the spotted grassveld lily, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllis family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in grassland habitats and thrives in well-drained soils. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it produces showy blooms during the summer months. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it requires specific conditions to flourish.
